thread.title: Mesut Ozil’s family want him to return home as Arsenal star refuses to rule out move back to Bundesliga
thread.title_full: Mesut Ozil’s family want him to return home as Arsenal star refuses to rule out move back to Bundesliga

author: rforrester
title: Mesut Ozil’s family want him to return home as Arsenal star refuses to rule out move back to Bundesliga
text:
A post shared by Mesut Özil (@m10_official) on Jan 6, 2017 at 11:16am PST 
The Germany international is waiting to see if manager Arsene Wenger stays at the Emirates before deciding his next move. 
Keep up to date with all the latest news, gossip, rumours and done deals in SunSport’s live transfer blog 
But the 28-year-old could be influenced by his family who are trying to convince him of a return to the Bundesliga. 
Speaking to Sportbild about a return home, he said: “I don’t want to exclude that. 
“Many family members – my mother especially – would welcome it if I were closer to home. 
“I still have a year on my contract and I love this club. At the moment, everything is still open.” 
German giants Bayern Munich remains a potential destination and would be one of a handful of clubs who could match his wage demands. Alexis Sanchez casts doubts over Arsenal future after saying he wants to stay in London and play for winning team Yes way Jose Jose Mourinho is eyeing up a potential move for Atletico Madrid centre-back Jose Gimenez 'He is absurd' Jose Mourinho compares Manchester United's attempts to buy Neymar as like trying to crack open a vault Handy Andy Gladbach confirm Andreas Christensen WILL return to Chelsea after ace impressed Antonio Conte CUT AND DRIES Manchester United to offer £30m Dries Mertens £4.3m salary in bid to poach him from Napoli PA Archive 3 Mesut Ozil enjoyed four years in the Bundesliga with Schalke and then Werder Bremen 
But Ozil admits he is in no rush to leave the Emirates anytime soon and admits talks over extending his contract will happen ‘soon’. 
He told Die Welt: “I am contracted until 2018 and I feel very comfortable. 
“We’ll talk soon and then make a decision.” Arsenal star Mesut Ozil picks his Pro Evolution Soccer World XI
